snippet: Perhaps because of an N.C.A.A. rule that a conference must have 12 teams to stage a championship game, the Big 12 is the only one of the Big 5 conferences not to earn a berth in the inaugural College Football Playoff.
abstract: Marc Tracy On College Football column; Alabama, Oregon, Florida State and Ohio State are four teams selected for first ever college football playoff; Big 12 conference is left out after Texas Christian and Baylor miss the cut; Alabama and Ohio State will meet in Sugar Bowl and Oregon and Florida State will face off in Rose Bowl; winners will play for winner-take-all national title.
lead_paragraph: Perhaps because of an N.C.A.A. rule that a conference must have 12 teams to stage a championship game, the Big 12 is the only one of the Big 5 conferences not to earn a berth in the inaugural College Football Playoff.

headline.main: Big 12 Is Left With Its Nose Pressed Against Playoff Glass
headline.print_headline: Big 12 Is Left With Its Nose Pressed Against Playoff Glass
